I'm writing this for my friend Ranveer Allahbadia...

Life is challenging and it can test you. Ranveer has learnt that recently. One controversy, and years of value someone brought and hard work someone put in, can wither away. I‚Äôve also been advised not to be associated with him by lots of people I respect. That's how hard some of this can be. But a friendship is a friendship. And the lens through which I‚Äôve seen him remains deeply valued and respected.

Ranveer has long been admired by the masses of India. People inherently love him for who he is. And along with the love he manages to generate, I admire his discipline, consistency, and how deeply he cares about what he puts out into the world.

I want to share about three pieces of content I loved that helped me appreciate him better and learn from his work.

First is his latest documentary on hair. A powerful mix of vulnerability and research. One of the best pieces I‚Äôve seen on the subject. It‚Äôs classic Ranveer in a new avatar that people have loved, and people have always loved him for adding value to their lives. He does it in a great way here.

Second is his ‚ÄòTaakat‚Äô episode with Suresh Raina. It reinvented the podcast format. Not the same static setup. It felt like you were in the room with them. It shows how well he understands film and camera.

Third is his piece on the platinum button. The way it was shot and delivered was exceptional. The kind of content that reminds you why you started.

People have said rude things. Doubted him. Scrutinized his every word.
Through all the noise, he‚Äôs kept creating. Kept showing up.

He‚Äôs doing some of the best work I‚Äôve seen. I respect him for that. And I love him like a brother. 

Kudos to @ranveerallahbadia, the team, and the co-founder of beerbiceps @join2manish and @nachiket.nisal the man managing the Rocket.

Imagine being the first in your family to ever hold a book, to dream beyond the fields, to see a world no one ever told you existed.

That‚Äôs what Vidyavaan is doing‚Äîone child at a time.

Across 18 villages and 22 learning centers in Palghar, we reach 495+ children every single day. 

Many of them come from families where education has never been a priority‚Äînot because they don‚Äôt care, but because survival always came first.

But we‚Äôre breaking the cycle.

For 2 hours a day, 6 days a week, these children step into a world of learning‚Äîdeveloping life skills and study skills that shape their future.

But we know a hungry mind can‚Äôt focus.

So before or after every class, we provide them with a meal or snack‚Äîensuring no child learns on an empty stomach.

And the most heartwarming part? The teachers aren‚Äôt outsiders‚Äîthey‚Äôre from their own villages. People they trust, guiding them towards a future they never thought possible.

Vidyavaan is more than just education. It‚Äôs a revolution of hope.

It‚Äôs about breaking barriers, building futures, and rewriting destinies.

But there‚Äôs still a long way to go.
Many children still drop out. Many still don‚Äôt see the power of learning.
And that‚Äôs where YOU come in.

- If this inspires you, share it. Let‚Äôs make education a priority for every child.
- Tag someone who believes in this cause.
- Want to help? Join us in making a difference.

Because when a child learns, a future brightens. And that‚Äôs a future worth fighting for. üíô

‚úÖ Managing conflicts constructively for an stress-free learning environment.

Imagine a world where every parent-teacher meeting is a collaboration, not a confrontation.
